channel.title: Pulling 3d data from the client
channel.description:
I am interested in pulling certain 3d data out of the Runescape client. Specifically the data relating to the actual map and possibably the buildings and structures on the map.
Dumping the data in to a format I can parse is easy enough. The problem I'm having is finding the data.
Does anyone have any clues to where I can intercept the data? I'm looking for somewhere between it getting pulled out of the file_store_32 data files and it actually being drawn to the screen. If you know the rough class(s) its in I can find the rest.

item.title: Pulling 3d data from the client
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

bentski made a model viewer, so he did managed to dump the data to a other format

Read full topic

item.title: Pulling 3d data from the client
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

they are in the data files, your best bet is to hack the client and find the class that contains the model information, then dump from there

Read full topic
